channel.title: Adding Customs Help InsidiaX[PI]
channel.description:
Well I have looked at so many guides on help with adding customs but i just can't find any useful ones, if you can contact me on skype my name is tank.donascape or can someone just tell me how to add customs? thanks.
Also when a few people try to get on my server it says 'error connecting to server' thanks

item.title: Adding Customs Help InsidiaX[PI]
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

Ok how to add models for pi //written by mehhh

Ok first download the models u want.
Then put the .dat files in the Raw folder of your cache.

(If you do not got an raw folder, then use an rsmodeldecompressor.
Add the models there run the decompres and add the models.dat and models.idx to ur cache files.)

Now u have to add the correct item int into ur itemdef.java or to your itemdef2.java.
Ok now the most of the time the item ints are in the download.
If they arent then duplicate one of the item cases in your itemdef(2).java and replace the case name with your new itemid and thr modelid with your dropmode, of the item.
And the ant165 and the ant200 (which stand for male equipment and female equipment.)
to the male and female (sometimes they are the same) modelid.
Ok now njst change the itemname to your itemname and the item description to your description.

Ok now save and compile (post any errors here or pm me them and i will fix for you.)

Now server sided

Open up item.cfg and add an new item (the item id will be your case number in the itemdef(2).java)

Ok now save and compile

Run the server and client and spawn the item

(I wrote this damn fast so no rage on my grammar

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Customs Help InsidiaX[PI]
item.dc:creator: @iBunnie iBunnie
item.description:
@iBunnie wrote:

Host Gushers:

Well i can solve the “error connecting thingy” its because they do not have the cache installed and or its because they dont have environment variables.

This has nothing to do with cache actually it’s possibly because his ISP is blocking that persons ip from connecting, you’re port isnt forwarded, or that person MAY be banned/ipbanned.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Customs Help InsidiaX[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

What do u mean u wanna add customs? Custom items? if so ill give u some steps (spoonfeeding)

put the models in cache>raw

put the ints in itemdef.java (client side)

Go into item.cfg (source) and add the item u want to add…

Yur done.

Read full topic
